googledrive part of the tidyverse
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • File identification
    • The Drive API

Identify files on Google Drive.

Converts various representations of Google Drive files into a dribble, the object used by googledrive to hold Drive file metadata. Files can be specified via

  • File path

  • File id (be sure to mark with as_id() to distinguish from file path!)

  • List representing Files resource objects (for internal use)

  • Data frame or dribble (for internal use)

as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for dribble
as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for default
as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for NULL
as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for character
as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for drive_id
as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for data.frame
as_dribble(x, ...)

# S3 method for list
as_dribble(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A vector of Drive file paths, a vector of file ids marked with as_id(), a list of Files Resource objects, or a suitable data frame.
...

Other arguments passed down to methods.

Details

This is a generic function.

Examples

not_run({
  ## specify the path
  as_dribble("abc")
  as_dribble("abc/def")

  ## specify the file id (substitute one of your own!)
  as_dribble(as_id("0B0Gh-SuuA2nTOGZVTXZTREgwZ2M"))
})
